meanings.definition: Unleavened bread traditionally eaten during Passover.
meanings.sent1: During Passover, we always have matzohs on the table.
meanings.sent2: My family enjoys eating matzohs with charoset during the holiday.
meanings.sent3: The matzohs decided to have a race to see who would be eaten first.
meanings.sent4: The matzohs lined up like soldiers ready for battle on the plate.
meanings.sent5: The smell of freshly baked matzohs filled the kitchen, reminding us of the holiday.

meanings.sent1: I bought two boxes of matzohs for the Seder dinner.
meanings.sent2: The matzohs were stacked neatly on the pantry shelf.
meanings.sent3: The matzohs in the store looked like a tower waiting to be eaten.
meanings.sent4: The matzohs on the plate resembled a pile of thin, crispy disks.
meanings.sent5: The children happily crunched on the matzohs, savoring the flavor of tradition.
